datafield.subfield: Howard Ashman (1950-1991) was a lyricist, librettist, playwright and director. The papers chiefly consist of materials from his work, including his collaborations with composer Alan Menken, such as Little Shop of Horrors and the Disney animated musicals The Little Mermaid, Beauty and the Beast, and Aladdin. Materials include scripts, piano-conductor scores, correspondence, business papers, photographs, scrapbooks, posters, clippings, notes, research materials, programs, promotional materials, writings, drawings, sketches, storyboards, address and date books, and memorial tributes.
Beauty and the beast (Motion picture music)

titlestmt.author: Processed by the Music Division of the Library of Congress

seriesstmt.titleproper: Guides to Special Collections in the Music Division of the Library of Congress

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Library of Congress Music Division, 2012

change.item: This finding aid was updated by Janet McKinney in 2013 to include additional materials.

did.head: Collection Summary
did.abstract: Howard Ashman (1950-1991) was a lyricist, librettist, playwright and director. The papers chiefly consist of materials from his work, including his collaborations with composer Alan Menken, such as Little Shop of Horrors and the Disney animated musicals The Little Mermaid, Beauty and the Beast, and Aladdin. Materials include scripts, piano-conductor scores, correspondence, business papers, photographs, scrapbooks, posters, clippings, notes, research materials, programs, promotional materials, writings, drawings, sketches, storyboards, address and date books, and memorial tributes.

note.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the Library's online catalog. They are grouped by name of person or organization, by subject or location, and by occupation and listed alphabetically therein.

controlaccess.head: People
controlaccess.persname: Menken, Alan. Beauty and the beast (Motion picture music)
Menken, Alan. God bless you, Mr. Rosewater.
Menken, Alan. Little mermaid (Motion picture music)
Menken, Alan. Little shop of horrors.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: Gift of Sarah Ashman Gillespie (sister) and William Lauch (partner); 2008, 2011, and 2013.

processinfo.head: Processing History
processinfo.p: The Howard Ashman Papers were processed by Amy Lauder, Janet McKinney, Shannon Pahl, and Mai Young in 2011 and 2013. Janet McKinney coded the finding aid for EAD format in 2012 and 2013.

separatedmaterial.head: Transfers
separatedmaterial.p: Audiovisual materials have been transferred to the Library of Congress Motion Picture, Broadcasting and Recorded Sound Division. An inventory of this material is available in the Music Division's collection file.

userestrict.head: Copyright Status
userestrict.p: Materials from the Howard Ashman Papers are governed by the Copyright Law of the United States (Title 17, U.S.C.) and other applicable international copyright laws.

accessrestrict.head: Access and Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: The Howard Ashman Papers are open to research. Researchers are advised to contact the Music Division prior to visiting in order to determine whether the desired materials will be available at that time.
Certain restrictions to use or copying of materials may apply.

altformavail.head: Electronic Files
altformavail.p: Electronic files were received as part of the Howard Ashman Papers. Consult reference staff in the Performing Arts Reading Room for more information.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: [item, date, container number], Howard Ashman Papers, Music Division, Library of Congress, Washington, D.C.

chronitem.event: Born, Baltimore, Maryland to Shirley and Raymond Ashman
The Confirmation, a play by Ashman, produced at Princeton's McCarter Theater
Became artistic director, WPA Theatre, New York, N.Y.
Adapted and directed Kurt Vonnegut's God Bless You, Mr. Rosewater, his first collaboration with Alan Menken
Premiere of Little Shop of Horrors, book, lyrics, and direction by Ashman and music by Menken

Won New York Drama Critics' Circle Award for Best Musical, Drama Desk Award for Outstanding Musical and Outstanding Lyrics, and Outer Critics Circle Award for Best Off Broadway Musical for Little Shop of Horrors

eventgrp.event: Premiere of Smile, with book, lyrics, and direction by Ashman and music by Marvin Hamlisch
Film version of Little Shop of Horrors released, with screenplay by Ashman

chronitem.event: Oliver & Company released; Ashman contributed lyrics to "Once Upon a Time in New York City" with music by Barry Mann; his first collaboration with Disney
The Little Mermaid released, with lyrics by Ashman and music by Menken
Received Academy Award for Best Original Song and Golden Globe Award for Best Original Song for "Under the Sea" from The Little Mermaid
Received Grammys for Best Recording for Children for The Little Mermaid and Best Song Written Specifically for a Motion Picture or Television for "Under the Sea" from The Little Mermaid
Died from complications from AIDS, New York City
Beauty and the Beast released, with lyrics by Ashman and music by Menken

eventgrp.event: Received Academy Award and Golden Globe Award for Best Original Song for "Beauty and the Beast" from Beauty and the Beast
Aladdin released, with lyrics by Ashman and Tim Rice, music by Menken

chronitem.event: Received Grammys for Best Album for Children for Beauty and the Beast and Best Song Written Specifically for a Motion Picture or Television for "Beauty and the Beast" from Beauty and the Beast
Premiere of staged musical Beauty and the Beast
Little Shop of Horrors revival opened

eventgrp.event: Premiere of staged musical The Little Mermaid
Howard Sings Ashman released on PS Classics

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The Howard Ashman Papers span the period 1973-2010, with the majority of the materials dating from 1982-1991. Materials include scripts, piano-conductor scores, correspondence, business papers, photographs, scrapbooks, posters, clippings, notes, research materials, programs, promotional materials, writings, drawings, sketches, storyboards, biographical materials, address and date books, and memorial tributes.

The Project Files include materials for stage and film works and are arranged alphabetically by project name. When known, the original production information has been provided. In the case of Little Shop of Horrors where the musical was subsequently filmed, the materials for the film have been included with the stage materials. Project files consist of scripts and script fragments arranged chronologically, scores, notes, research materials, business papers, correspondence, programs, and clippings.

Biographical Materials include early writings and school project materials, address and date books, and memorial tributes. The correspondence consists chiefly of personal letters received by Ashman throughout his career, get-well wishes during his illness, and condolence letters to his sister Sarah after Ashman's death.

The Miscellany series contains general clippings, writings by others, and a few uncategorized items. The writings by others primarily contain plays or musicals in draft form, some of which are annotated. A list of unannotated published scripts that were not retained is kept in the collections file in the Library of Congress Music Division.

arrangement.head: Organization of the Howard Ashman Papers
arrangement.p: The Howard Ashman Papers are organized in three series:
